text.0: ye made that atri worn with eld free as a horse to win the goal.
text.1: when ye restored to youth and strength kakṣīvān like a car renewed.
text.2: ye freed that atri like a horse and brought him newlyborn to earth.
text.3: ye loosed him like a firmtied knot which gods unsoiled by dust had bound.
text.4: heroes who showed most wondrous power to atri strive to win fair songs.
text.5: for then o heroes of the sky your hymn of praise shall cease no more.
text.6: this claims your notice bounteous gods  oblation aśvins and our love.
text.7: that ye o heroes in the fight may bring us safe to ample room.
text.8: ye twain to bhujyu tossed about in ocean at the regions end.
text.9: nāsatyas with your winged sterds came nigh and gave him strength to win.
text.10: come with your joys most liberal gods lords of all treasures bringing weal.
text.11: like fresh full waters to a well so heroes come and be with us.
